original: Ljungberg, Martin Samuel, civilingenjör, Norrköping, f. 6/12/94 i Norrköp. av politierådm. Wilhelm L. o. Tekla Peterson. G. 26 m. Elise Hedberg. Barn: Karin f. 27, Anders 28, Åke 32, Kerstin 34. — Stud:ex. i Norrköp. 13, civiling:ex. v. KTH (VoV) 18. Bitr. ing. i östra väg- o. vatten-byggnidistr. 18-21, tekn. chef i Motala Ströms regler :fören. sed. 22, egen konsult. ing:firma sed. 24. Styr:led. i Norrköp.-Söderköp.-Vikbolandets Järnv. sed. 34, ordf. sed. 37, styr :ied. i Trafikförv. Östergötl. ’ Smalspår. Järnv. sed. 36, v. ordf. sed. 37, ordf. i A-B Peridon sed. 45, i ^styr. f. Norrk. Tidn. A-B sed. 43, rev. i östergötl. Ensk. Banks A-B 41-47 m. m., led. av stadsfullm. (h) sed. 27, ied. av slakthusstyr. 27-38, drätselkamm. 33-40 m. fl. kommun, uppdrag, led. av riksd. andra kamm. sed. 41. Ordf. i Norrköp. polytekn. fören. 38-42. Skr.: Vattenkraften i östergötl. (Tekn. Tidskr. 34), Motaila Ströms regler iförenings jub:skr. (delvis, 41). RVO.
translated: Ljungberg, Martin Samuel, civil engineer, Norrköping, born on December 6, 1894 in Norrköping, to police councilor Wilhelm L. and Tekla Peterson. Married on June 26, 19XX to Elise Hedberg. Children: Karin, born in 1927, Anders in 1928, Åke in 1932, Kerstin in 1934. Studied at Norrköping High School, graduated in 1913, graduated as a civil engineer from KTH (VoV) in 1918. Assistant engineer in the Eastern Road and Water Construction District from 1918 to 1921, technical director of Motala Ströms Regulations Association since 1922, owner of his own consulting engineering firm since 1924. Board member of Norrköping-Söderköping-Vikbolandets Railway since 1934, chairman since 1937, board member of Trafikförvaltningen Östergötlands Smalspår Järnväg since 1936, vice chairman since 1937, chairman of A-B Peridon since 1945, in the board of directors of Norrköpings Tidning AB since 1943, auditor in Östergötlands Enskilda Bank AB from 1941 to 1947, etc. Member of the city council (conservative party) since 1927, member of the slaughterhouse board from 1927 to 1938, member of the municipal finance committee from 1933 to 1940, and various other municipal assignments. Member of the second chamber of the parliament since 1941. Chairman of Norrköping Polytechnic Association from 1938 to 1942. Wrote: "Vattenkraften i östergötl." (Water power in Östergötland, Technical Journal 1934), "Motaila Ströms regler förening jubilee book" (partly, 1941). Knight of the Royal Order of Vasa.
